Message.Msg: Haven't you read how the analysts are punishing Intel for too much Capital spending. Isn't it funny that they have to now use their bleeding edge for 25% GM products just to be # 5 (may be 10) behind Apple Arm, QCOM Arm, Nvidia Arm and Mediatek. That's not a problem? AMD took Intel's margins a couple of notches down when they came on to the scene - that was nothing compared to what's unfurling in the next 24 months. The downward spiral can be faster if Microsoft mobile strategy gets traction. Thanks to Google's commitment to supporting Intel - they'll have a shot at staying relevant in the new age - at what cost? ..... 25% GM eventually.

WS now views INTC as a dividend stock, rather than a technology company with growth prospects. You can discern this from its general trading patterns. In a way Intel is treading on unchartered waters; its competitiveness in the mobile space is virtually unknown.

Message.Title: Snapdragon 800 shows up in benchmarks, 10% faster than Exynos 5 Octa
Message.Msg: Whoopee! (Is that all?)

Topic.Title: Snapdragon 800 shows up in benchmarks, 10% faster than Exynos 5 Octa

Message.Msg: Linkety link?

If Intel's at 25% GM, what do you think Nvidia will have? Or Qualcomm? Or any mobile chip maker? No, gross margins in this space are much better than 25%, and you're being completely disingenuous if you're pumping Nvidia and then bashing Intel for going after mobile chips.

Intel is NOT GOING after mobile chips - Intel is GOING NOWHERE - Medfield was SO GOOD and all that was before and after. Sorry it went NOWHERE. Seen the latest HP Chromebook based on Celeron - price wasn't too bad without diving into too much details What a POS - 4.5 hours play time...huh? 3.5 Lbs huh? 1366×768????? So if it was a 1080p display - playtime would be 1 hr? That's the joke with every Intel device - they are competitive in their own minds - stuck at 768P

Topic.Title: Snapdragon 800 shows up in benchmarks, 10% faster than Exynos 5 Octa

Message.Msg: qcom has always taken a different path than ARM for power management, google that. For A15 round, they are way out ahead in performance. T3 got the last Nexus round, T4 will completely sit out anything in Nexus. No Nexus, no volume. No wonder Jen has been talking up Logan and beyond in the last 3 months. You can count T4 as dead sales wise. BTW, the Shield did not cost nvda $10M to develop. True cost of development needs to include the Tegra loses - ala Shield cost $1B. It would have cost only $10M is nvda has just used outside silicon instead.
Medfield was just the first step. Crawl, walk, run...it applies to everything. Medfield = Crawl Clover Trail = Walk Baytrail/Merrifield = Run
Yeah right. Ashraf still crawling, drooling over dinosaur stocks, and blabbering

Message.Title: Acer video teases an Android tablet from Computex 2103....reportedly powered by Tegra 4
Message.Msg: Acer hasn’t been a big name lately in Android tablets, but they’ve still been releasing some pretty decent slates. We have a feeling a Tegra 4 device is in the works from Acer, but won’t know until their global press conference on June 3rd for Computex. It’s about time we see some new flagship tablets from Acer. SOURCE: Android Community //androidcommunityDOTcom/acer-video-teases-upcoming-tablets-from-computex-2013-20130528/ _______ Tegra 4 tablet wins so far: 1. HP SlateBook x2 (formally announced0 2. Toshiba AT10 LE and 15 (formally announced) 3. Microsoft Surface RT 8" (specs leaked; formal announcement around the corner) 3. ASUS next-gen Transformer Infinity: to be announced next week at COmputex 4. Acer tablet unnamed tablet (to be announced next week at Computex) And Qualcomm marketing has been spreading rumors that Tegra 4 received no contract wins...lol Another point: in the years ahead, growth of tablets will outpace that of smartphone according to several industry analysts such as IDC and Gartner.
